runs.comm: short and wide and dismissed through point for four, that'll settle Guptill nicely
tighter line, shapes back a little, nicely steered away through backward point for a couple
inswinger and bowled 'im! Guptill loses his leg stump, Willey slips one past the bat, maybe kissed the pad on the way through. Punches the air and lets out a growl of satisfaction
goes full and straight, worked off the toes through midwicket for one to get going
pitched up outside off, stand and deliver from the NZ captain, plugs four over mid-off's head. Statement stroke
beats him, nicely bowled! Wasn't full enough but McCullum came after it anyway, zipped past the bat and through to Bairstow
back of a length, Williamson hops into line and nudges one through square leg
bit of width and McCullum carves four wide of third man, backed away and chopped belligerently it over gully
oh, nearly a drag-on! Short of a length and Finn nearly gets his man, similar to his Chester-le-Street dismissal but this time the ball squeezed past the stumps
gone, smashed over deep square leg! Length ball from Finn, he pirouettes on the spot and spanks it into the crowd... where it's dropped
shortish on off stump, chopped to point, takes on the arm of Roy, whose throw was off target
full and straight, timed on the drive but finds mid-on
on the stumps, tucked into the leg side
pitched up and nailed back over the bowler's head, six more for McCullum! Brutal swing of the bat - that takes McCullum past Gayle as the sixiest hitter in T20 internationals
shortish, squirted off the thigh pad through square
good length, pushed across the right-hander, driven square off the back foot for a couple
dragged down on leg stump and Williamson whips a pull behind square, Rashid does really well to stop it diving to his left on the edge of the circle, prevents four
back of a length on the stumps, jumps back and squeezes it towards midwicket
length delivery, here comes Baz again, skip and a whirl of the arms and he sends the ball into the crowd at deep midwicket, six more
length again, in the channel, maybe some extra pace and this flies off the bat, free swinging cut in front of square, into the stands at deep extra cover. Powah
shortish, at the body, tucked into the leg side
drops back outside off and runs one to third man
length outside off, Williamson waits and dabs to third man with soft hands

follows him as B-Mac steps to leg, edges a low full toss... into off stump! Bit of a miscue from McCullum, he was looking to whip it over midwicket, maybe got beaten for pace, it was 88mph and ricocheted off the bat, flattening the stump. Wood went wide on the crease and fired it in, then wheeled away in celebration. That's only his fourth T20 wicket
tossed up - maybe the offbreak to start with? - Williamson dances forward and slices through the covers, shouts of "catch!" but it was into a gap
flat legbreak on off stump, it's actually a bit short and Williamson slaps four more in front of square
floated up and flicked through midwicket into an open space
pushed through outside off, Williamson goes back and dabs towards short third man... a direct hit would have had Taylor struggling
floated up on middle and off, cute little paddle to leg from Taylor and he gets it past a rather lumbering dive from Hales on the 45, runs all the way
little bit short and chopped in front of square - expensive opener from Rashid
short of a length over the top of off stump, punched through the covers off the back foot
short on the stumps and flicked away through square leg
full and worked back wide of mid-on
rolls his fingers over the ball, this was drifting towards leg stump and all Williamson had to do was help it on its way past short fine leg
good length in the corridor, goes back and glides one down to third man

attacks the stumps, holds up a touch and Taylor gets a leading edge, it drops short of mid-on running in and the throw misses, too - still, a single-figure over for England, their first of the innings
good length on middle and off, closes the face and nudges one through midwicket
full on the stumps, leans into a clip down the ground to long-on
short outside off, 84mph and swatted away over midwicket, forehand smash from Taylor and it's into a gap for another boundary
drops back and tucks one into the leg side, Morgan hits the stumps.... but it deflects away and they get a second
short of a length, Taylor rolls the wrists and nudges one more through midwicket
that's a decent nut, seams away from Williamson off a length as he hung the bat out
good length on off stump, pushed down to long-on

back-of-the-hand slower ball and Williamson watches it on to the bat, chips over mid-off with that easy grace we're accustomed to seeing, it teases Morgan all the way and reaches the rope moments before the diving fielder
fullish, outside off, bunted into the covers coming forwards
length in the channel, drops into the crease and runs one to third man
slightly back of a length, Taylor shows it a straight bat on off stump

got him dropped him, clear edge from Taylor trying to run the ball to third man and it clangs off Bairstow's fingers and straight to earth! Bairstow immediately signals for some attention on his finger... it's unwanted attention on his glovework that he'll get
tossed up outside off, straightening a touch and cut through backward point

gives it some air, dips as Taylor comes after him... and he skies a slog to mid-off! Safely pouched by Willey, so Taylor's extra life is a short one. Nicely done by Rashid, gets Taylor after causing him problems with little success during the ODIs
short and a touch wide, cut behind backward point - who actually moved forward in anticipation - and Billings can't reel it in despite a terrific dive on the boundary
pushed through outside off, can't get this cut through
drops short, on the stumps, Williamson nearly falls over heaving a pull through midwicket
flat legbreak on off stump, tucked firmly out to deep midwicket, thinks about a second but Williamson declines
length on off stump, swings and misses - shiver-me-timbers, bowled! Ill-considered swipe from Munro, hanging back to a delivery that wasn't short enough to pull, ugly shot and off popped the bails
pitched up outside off, 85mph and Ronchi leans into a street-hardened punch through the covers, crisp stroke to get going
full and wide this time, lofted drive through the covers, there's a sweeper in the deep
tight line, 85mph on off stump, KW plays it late through third man for one
length ball outside off, rolling the fingers over it, cut to backward point

short ball, at the batsman, who ducks... and then tries to ramp it, sends the ball high and into the keeper's gloves! That was another cutter from Stokes, no pace for Ronchi to work with, decided to play it late but only sent it vertical
turn into the pads, this is just pushed back to the bowler
sliding outside off, this is cut wide of long-off who does well to save the boundary
length ball played with the turn to midwicket
slider into middle and leg, this is flicked behind square leg for a sharp single
dragged down but Williamson falls over pulling it and only finds deep square
floated up outside off, goes to square drive and misses
length ball at the off stump, this is defended back to the bowler
full and a gorgeous drive races past mid-off, perfect timing and placement on that
cutter wide of off stump, inside the guideline, Williamson misses with a cut
fuller length on a similar line and this is driven away up and over backward point, well timed away from third man
back on off stump, this is calmly blocked back to the bowler
back of a length at the body, this is steered away backward of square, four more
floated up on leg stump, this cannons the pad and runs out on the leg side
back in the crease pushing this through midwicket and Williamson brings up fifty, written that a few times this tour too, 31 balls
down the wicket, clips this out through square leg playing with the turn
reaches out to a low full toss well outside off and drags this down to long-on
slog swept in the air down towards deep-backward square, drops a yard or two in front of the fielder
a very very late cut out of Bairstow's gloves, short third man does really well diving to his left to save four
length ball around off stump, Williamson whips this out through square leg
slower short delivery, deceives Santner who misses trying to pull
another slowie, picks this up and whacks it towards deep midwicket, not that far from the fielder again
back of a length around off, Williamson stays leg side of this and dabs down to third man
goes to pull leg side again and mistimes it back to the bowler
another slower ball outside off, this is lifted wide enough of deep cover for a couple
length ball wide of off stump, this is cut out wide of deep cover
tighter line, this is clipped out to deep square this time

full at the off stump, Santner swings to leg and loses his off stump. A nasty hack across the line, done for pace and it was straight enough. Poor innings from Santner, looked very out of touch really, didn't time one and has simply swung across the line and missed this
fourth-stump line on a length, this is tapped out into the covers

similar ball, angled out into the covers, they go for the single, Willey goes across to his left throws down the batsman's stumps! And Kane Williamson is short of his ground, superb piece of fielding, finally England hit the stumps. Willey going his left - the right side for him - one-handed pick-up and throw and fires down the stumps

full length just outside off, Southee clearing the front leg strikes it sweet as a nut down the ground but straight to mid-off! Well held by Morgan, it was straight to him but hit bloody hard, right off the meat of the bat but Southee picked out Morgan and is that New Zealand's chance gone now?
swing and a miss to a full length ball just outside off
back of a length, slapped tennis-style straight to mid-off
slower ball on a straighter line, this is turned out into midwicket
shorter still and pulled this time off a top edge, it flies fine of long leg but Willey does really well going to his right
similar ball, this is a cutter and McCullum misses trying to cut
back to pull and finds long-on
full length wide of off stump, too wide

steps across the stumps and goes to paddle, gets a good contact but guides it straight to short long leg! Straight to Finn who takes the catch shuffling to his right at shoulder height. Little batting for McCullum, difficult to come out and blast it here. Got a good connection on this but couldn't steer it wide of the fielder

goes for a reverse-paddle to a slower ball and chips it straight to the keeper! That will do nicely for England. Hiding to nothing really for McClenaghan, going for the spectacular first up, gets this off a top edge and it lobbed up to Bairstow
